intro: Limnophila sessilis, commonly known as the water thyme, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, often fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its leaves are usually opposite and may have a waxy coating to help retain moisture. Limnophila sessilis is often used in aquatic gardens and can serve as a habitat for various small aquatic organisms.
